study: This study investigates several psychosocial characteristics of Type A and B individuals, particularly relationships between personality and CHD risk factors such as smoking, lack of exercise, recent stress, and a family history of CHD. This paper includes women.
findings: There was a failure to observe any clear cut relationships between the A/B classification and personal characteristics such as age, sex, and smoking.
Neither smoking nor lack of exercise was associated with a family history of CHD.
